name: Lighthouse Court

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel, beautifully clean and nice comfortable rooms. Great aircon, nice little pool and basic breakfast. Walking distance from town and helpfully situated next to a lighthouse so you can find your way home following twelfty keylimetini's. Jeremiah is a total legend and made our stay even better with his helpful, attentive and friendly way.
reviews.title: Magnificent little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful stay we had . The Staff are friendly and were always helpful .
reviews.title: A good one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean . We had one overlooking the swimming pool which isn't a huge pool but is enough to keep you cool and it had a nice relaxing atmosphere with everyone gathered round it . The cocktails were amazing and were different to what I had experienced on honeymoon .
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: Location was great Duval Street and all the sights were walking distance street parking was free plenty spaces .
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: This was our second time staying here. Love the location! Beautiful property. Wonderful "Key West" feel. The staff couldn't be friendlier!! Don't think we will stay anywhere else. Can't wait to come back next year.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Love!

reviews.text: The location is good: in front of Hemingway's house, 4 blocks from mile 0, close to southern point and Dumont st. But the price is excessive for the size of the room, which is old, and in our case not clean when we entered nor when we left (they didn't seem to clean that much). Small but nice swimming pool with their own sample of the local animal: a rooster (sharp calls every morning).... Will try a different place on our next visit
reviews.title: Only the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Lighthouse Court on my honeymoon in Key West. The location was really great. Easily walk to any place in Old Town including all of the major tourist attractions (Mallory Square, Duval St etc), in fact the Hemingway House is directly across the street and the Old Lighthouse next door (hence the name). They have a small pool, don't expect to swim laps but it is great for cooling off while getting some sun in their patio area which also has the Mojito Bar where you can get drinks. Any room would work especially if you do not plan on spending much time in your room but we had one right on Whitehead St and it was very cool to be able to sit on the porch and do some people watching. I would highly recommend staying here if spending time in downtown Key West.
reviews.title: Great location for sight seeing or night out

reviews.text: My husband and I planned a vacation to the island and we were NOT disapointed. We do allot of research before going anywhere and we found this place through trip adviser. This place was amazing. The staff was great. The rooms were what I expected but the place as the most peaceful, amazing vibe! I dare say it was the most relaxing hotel stay that we have ever had!!!! Key west was beautiful! Being centrally located made the experience even better. We didn't hear the chickens at all not that, that would of bothered us anyway. They have ceiling fans in the room too which makes such an amazing difference!
reviews.title: We will be back!!!

reviews.text: The breakfast by the pool is simple, and watch out for the chickens. They have a distraction technique and before you know it a crosaint is gone..loll...but it just added to the charm!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This quaint hotel was situated in the most perfect area of Key West, where my husband and I spent 2 nights for a close friend's destination wedding. We walked to all the festivities throughout the weekend and even to the beach. It is right across from the Hemingway House, which is a big attraction with its six-toed cats. Key West is hot and oppressively humid in July. Coming from LA it was very apparent, and the rooms just couldn't get cool enough. Probably because I could see the sun shining in through every corner of the front door, and the bathroom wasn't temperature controlled so every time we took a shower it was instant sweat. Also the shower head was weak, and the pressure only got a bit higher if you were wiling to take a hot shower. The pool was warm and perfect, and our bartender at the pool bar, Peter, was a great guy and always made us feel like part of the family. There is also a shady area to play Cornhole, which was actually quite fun for a group of friends. For over $250 a night, I just don't think it was worth it. But location, location, location.
reviews.title: Nice but not for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Lighthouse Court property in Key West during the 2 day lobster fest. We didn't realize that hotels were all going to be full when we booked but there wasn't a vacancy anywhere. The property is in a great location across the street from Hemingway House, center of Old Key West but far enough away from the craziness of Duval Street. The staff is very accommodating, knowledgeable of the area and friendly but the property is a little worn and run down. The pool is small and looked like an overstuffed bath tub when we arrived. The Mojito Bar is convenient for a drink by the pool but expensive. The hotel has an outdoor continental breakfast daily with limited choices but great strong coffee. As for the room, it was dated and in need of new furniture, paint and carpet. The sheets weren't very soft and seamed cheap. The maid staff uses the top sheet for the fitted one and it comes untucked from the mattress. The shower is large with glass doors and new tile but limited counter space and old beat up tile on the floor. We had a room near the pool but the noise stopped at 10 so it didn't disturb us. All in all, its a decent property but could use an update
reviews.title: Nice Amenities and Large Rooms - Needs updating and a good cleaning

reviews.text: Room was clean and comfortable and the location could not be beat. The staff were very friendly and helped us figure our way around. Loved the small courtyard and pool, breakfast in the courtyard was simple but nice. Beds were comfortable and the hotel was quiet at night. The whole place had a local vibe - clearly not a chain.
reviews.title: Great Location, friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a lot of time reviewing this place before our trip. Boy, there are so many mixed reviews. I have nothing bad to say about this place! it was cozy, clean, romantic and relaxing! We got checked in on a Thursday night after we drove down from Miami. The lady in the office, Rose, was very sweet. We felt welcomed! We were lucky to be able to leave our rental car parked on the street for one night. There truly are no parking spots at all... so seriously do not plan on parking close by! We got room E7, and it was amazing! The room seemed newly renovated. The only odd thing was this step in shower. It seemed like it was more for a Las Vegas suite, but it was still pretty neat. The bed was comfy. We couldnt hear the roosters at 4 am from our room. Of course, we prolly didnt hear it over our ac going full blast all night. I think I woke up at 1 am a few times and could hear them though. Prolly a good idea to bring a fan or noise machine if you are planning to stay here.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The breakfast was free and was served at 8 in the pool area. Yes, its true they have roosters and little hens running around wanting ya to give them some food. They had the same stuff everyday. I wish they could of had some variety with the fruits. Each morning there was an offering of coffee(decaf is available too), light n fit yogurt (and regular activia yogurt), a choice of different cereals(fruit loops, special k, corn pops), weird bagels and croissant(raw in the middle with a piece of ham...VERY strange... yuck), blueberry muffins, apples and oranges. Yeah I was pretty passionate about this breakfast! haha!
reviews.title: Cute place with a magnificent location
lovely place great location
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights here last week , we had basic room which was very clean and great value for money. Lovely hotel, nice pool, helpful staff. Would definitely stay again.great location for duvall st and all the action . Yet very quiet spot.

My lady and I spent four nights here and loved it! The hotel is really quite historical thus, the rooms are a bit smaller. However, they are very nicely appointed and comfortable. The grounds are nice and pool area private for afternoon dips. The nice part is that once we parked our car, we never needed it again since you are wiyh in walking distance of almost everything. One block from Duval street, you can walk to any of the great restaurants or fabulous night clubs in minutes. I highly recommend this Inn for the price, location, and convenience.
reviews.title: Right in the center of Key West action!

reviews.text: If you want to stay and feel like the locals this is the place. Perfect location, park your car and you can walk wherever you want. Staff is very friendly. Rooms were nice size. Pool area with Mojito Bar is awesome. Across from Hemmingway House and one block from Duvall Street. You will love this place. Standard rooms do not have a fridge or microwave or coffee pot. But, the continental breakfast is right out your door practically at the pool.
reviews.title: Lighthouse Court, Key West

reviews.text: I stayed at the Lighthouse Court with my sister for one night, and we had an excellent experience at the hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent service and atmosphere
Nice peaceful place to stay
reviews.text: The staff was very kind and helpful from the moment we came, so sweet and receptive.

description: Lighthouse Court is one of five hotels in the Historic Key West Inns collection and is located next door to the Key West Lighthouse Museum and across the street from the Ernest Hemingway Home and Museum. Forty guestrooms are spread out within ten buildings, creating a spacious and relaxing environment. Buildings are separated by brick pathways, tropical landscaping, and decked courtyards. The grounds provide many comfortable spots for lounging, sunning, or gazing up at the lighthouse. Guests can relax around the large pool in the main courtyard while sipping on tropical drinks from the pool bar. Just one block off Duval Street, the location affords instant access to some of our favorite things to do in Key West including the Mallory Square sunset celebration, Sloppy Joe’s Bar & Margaritaville.
